intro: Daucus artedia, commonly known as the Artedia carrot, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes other familiar plants like parsley and celery. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels. Its roots are typically small and less developed compared to those of cultivated carrots. Daucus artedia is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in cooler climates.
